dialog: In a few seconds, a young man will arrive at this bus stop.
Here he comes
His name is Nathan
He was sent here by the University of B. to search for a man called Dr. Coppelius, who disappeared about one year ago.
Although he arrived much later than he expected, Nathan begins his search for the mysterious Coppelius.
With nothing but a photograph of the doctor's house, the young man starts his journey through the dusky landscape.
Little does he expect that at the end of the path adventure is waiting for him ...
Yes, the members of the Smith Institute for Advanced Research.
Among us were leading scientists from all over the world, who together made the most stunning discoveries.
Do you recognize the man in the background?
Right, it's Vincent.
He was the reason the group split up in the end.
He tried to convince us to use our inventions to overthrow the government.
Of course we declined. We then decided to cease our official researches.
Vincent disappeared.
Years passed and I slowly lost contact with my colleagues. In his last message, Professor Smith wrote only one line...
Vincent is back.
Who are you?!
What do you want?
Don't worry! I just want to know...
What Makes You Tick?!
That was scary, hu?
But don't worry, I'm still alive!
Thank goodness I was thrown out of the pod seconds before it hit the ground.
Now I need to get back to the lab and free Dr. Coppelius!
That was scary, uh?
Now I should get back to the house and free Dr. Coppelius!
There's a lighthouse off in the distance... but no light.
A boat is at anchor in the bay.
There's an old pier on the other side of the bay.
There's a piece of string caught in the branches.
A piece of string can be useful!
It's a sundial.
There's no sunlight, so I can't tell what time it is.
He's asleep. It seems that my sedatives worked.
I guess I can take the key now.
Okay, I have the key.
No. He deserves some rest.
Over there is a lighthouse.
It's too far away. They wouldn't hear me.
I don't think I'll hike over there ...
It was a massive stone bridge. It's collapsed.
I think that way leads to that village I saw on the map at home ... Ravenhollow.
I can't cross the bridge.
Ah, the sea.
No, the water looks really cold.
I've never done this before...
I guess I won't need that stupid fishing rod anymore.
I would have paid fifty bucks for it.
I'll just pretend like I didn't hear that.
I'll need to bait the hook before I can try fishing.
I'll need a float and bait before I can try fishing.
This fishing tackle is still incomplete.
Seems like there was a ferry coming here once.
Must have been a long time ago. I can't read the timetable anymore.
I can't read it. Even if I could it would still be useless.
I'm sure the ferry doesn't come here anymore.
It's a leaflet from the local fishing club.
I'll take it. I doubt anyone else needs it.
The leaflet was pinned to the board with a small fishing hook.
Somehow I feel like someone is watching me...
I'll have to take the long way through the fields ...
There's a boat at anchor.
Aye. That's me ship, the "Sea Cucumber".
Excuse me! May I borrow your boat?
Sorry. I can't lend you my boat.
Shroom and me, we'll have to get going soon...
We have to deliver these boxes before sunrise.
It's a rowboat.
He's asleep.
It looks like he's running in his dream.
Hey old boy!
Want to help me?
Old Shroom is tired. He won't help you if you have nothin' to offer.
What would he like to have?
He's a sailor, like me. Therefore he loves fish... Just like me.
Right boy?
I'll let him sleep.
Here, I heard you like fish...
Good idea ... but I think he's too tired.
It seems that I have his attention now.
Shroom, old chap. How are you?
That's great to hear.
I'd better not.
Ahem ...
Shroom! Come on, old boy! Find the SETA DE MUERTE!
See? ... the name is in this book here! Have a good look at it.
Wow, Shroom found a mushroom.
How convenient that it was hidden right under his nose.
No, he's done enough.
He looks a little dangerous.
What did you just say?
Nothing! Sorry!
Excuse me...
I don't think so.
How did Nora get here?
Her grandfather brought her and told me to wait for him.
Her grandfather? What did he look like?
Well, he looks a little bit like the first Doctor Who.
Who?
Aye! Just like him.
I'm confused.
Okay.
It's an old glove.
Ok.
The crab is living in an old glove.
Nature never fails to impress me.
Hey ... nice weather, hu?
It seems he's not interested in small talk.
It seems that he doesn't want to leave the glove.
Maybe I could persuade him to move out somehow...
Good idea, but the can is closed and full of Dr. Pepper.
Good idea, but the can is full of Dr. Pepper.
Well, maybe I could give away an empty can.
Let's see ...
Now the crab is living comfortably in a Dr. Pepper can.
He has a good taste.
No. He's had more than enough adventures for one day.
It seems she's not feeling well.
Nora, may I ask you something?
Not right now please, Nathan.
Sorry.
That wouldn't be nice.
These boxes contain unmarked bottles.
It smells like strong whiskey.
I'll take one.
No, you won't.
Right, I won't.
Well, he said I can have one...
I've already taken my share.
Hi, I'm Nathan. And you are ...
I'm Martin Munchkin McManus.
Is your name really "Munchkin"?
Aye.
Your parents must have liked "The Wizard of Oz".
I have no idea what you are talking about, kid.
Is your name really Martin "Munchkin" McManus?
Is that your dog?
Aye. T'is me mate.
What is his name?
His name is Shroom. Right boy?
Shroom? As in Mushroom?
Aye. He's a mushroom searching kind of dog.
Really?! I've heard of those!
Aye. If you show old Shroom here the name of the mushroom that you're searching for, he'll be on his feet in a second to find it for you.
He has to see it written down somewhere? That means he can read, too! Wow.
You said your dog can find mushrooms?
Fascinating...
I'm kind of stuck right now. Can you help?
I've been at the shores of Africa, I've wrestled the boxers of China, and I've seen the ghost of the pirate captain Stoertebecker.
...but still the most useful ideas and hints I've ever found are in the book "Capt'n Matt's Guide to Life".
Here, I happen to have a copy that I could give you.
Wow, thanks! "Capt'n Matt's Guide to Life". This sounds good. Sometimes I need guidance.
Aye. We all do, kid.
Don't you need this book? It sounds like it's important to you.
Aye. It is, but I have about fifty more copies at home. You can keep it, boy.
So giving me this copy won't diminish your collection?
Naw, I like to give them to strangers whenever possible. It spreads the word.
It's dark. You are standing at an old pier. Alone. With a couple of boxes containing unlabeled bottles of alcohol.
Hey! Are you doing something illegal?
Aye aye.
May I have a bottle?
Aye. Take one. Ten percent of the goods are meant to be used to bribe officials and those who know too much.
Aren't you afraid that I'm going to report you?
No. You've officially been bribed.
I guess you're right. And I might need a bottle.
So you aren't afraid that I'm going to report your shady activities?
No. I said you could take a bottle. You've been officially bribed.
Bye.
How are you?
Do you know what time it is?
That late?
It has a nice golden color.
I can hear crickets. I guess they live somewhere in there.
That's a good idea. I'll take some wheat.
I already have enough wheat.
The barrel is full of old tins and tools.
It's all rusty and useless.
Except, maybe, for that cocktail shaker on top.
It's a cocktail shaker, and it seems to be in good shape... unlike the rest of this scrap metal.
Alright.
Nice bench. It looks comfortable.
I don't want to rest now.
There are still mysteries to solve and plots to unfold.
It's a single glove.
Sorry, does this glove belong to you?
No, it was already here when I came.
Good. Then I'll take it.
Why? Is it your glove?
Uh ... yes?
Then why did you ask if it's mine?
... to test your honesty?
You passed the test! Congratulations.
I'll take the glove, okay?
*Sigh* Go ahead.
There's a scarecrow watching over this field.
If I were a bird, I'd be terrified.
It's pretty much useless... and far too big to pick up.
The sign says "Path to Sea".
There's some larger tools and bundles of wood. Nothing useful, I guess.
No, these tools are too heavy.
Mh ... it's a stone.
Hey, there's a wriggly worm under that stone!
It's a worm. He's wriggling.
Okay. I have the worm.
Who's he?
Excuse me...
Who's she?
Ahem ...
That wouldn't be very nice.
Something seems terribly wrong with Nora ...
Are you alright, Nora?
I ... I don't feel well ...
Please find my grandfather, Nathan ... he'll know what to do. See if he's around that house over there.
Please hurry Nathan. Mr. McManus has to take grandfather and I back home. I ... I need my medicine.
Don't worry, Nora. I'll find your grandfather!
And tell my grandfather that I found this ...
Is this some sort of key?
I think so. I assume it has something to do with that house my grandfather was trying to get into.
Okay, I'll look around that house for your grandfather.
What was I supposed to do with this key part?
Please give it to my grandfather ... he was trying to find a way into that house.
It's a fence of barbed wire.
I've got enough barbed wire.
Good idea, I may need some barbed wire...
But I'll need something to protect my hands to free it.
A single glove is rather useless.
I hear gloves are usually used in pairs...
Like shoes, you know.
Who's your grandfather? What's his name?
I'm not supposed to talk about him, sorry Nathan.
What is your grandfather doing here?
He has some business to do around here.
What kind of business?
I'm not quite sure.
He doesn't say much about his work... but he did tell me not to talk about him or his work with strangers.
Actually, he told me not to talk to strangers at all.
But we can talk because I introduced myself, right?
Right.
Isn't it kind of boring here?
I think it's nice ... and I have something to read while I'm waiting.
What are you reading?
Mungo Park: "Travels in the Interior of Africa". I got it from my grandfather...
That Mungo Park was a real adventurer.
What are you reading again?
Mungo Park: "Travels in the Interior of Africa".
I've learned enough about you, I think.
Who are you and what are you doing here?
I'm Nora. I was reading as you might have noticed.
But If you must know: I'm waiting for my grandfather.
Do you know a Dr. Coppelius?
Why do you ask?
I was sent to tell him that he's in danger.
In danger?
Yes. I don't know why, but he's supposed to contact the university immediately.
I wish I could help you... but I've been asked not to talk about him. Sorry.
So you know him?
Please, I can't answer that.
Okay, sorry.
You know, I can run really fast.
I'm excited to hear that.
Really?
Bye.
I'm Nathan. Who are you?
Young man, I am someone who knows that you don't belong here... so what are you doing here?
I'm searching for a Dr. Coppelius.
Oh really? That's quite interesting, I must say.
Do you know this Coppelius? I was sent to warn him that he may be in grave danger.
Of course I know him. He's quite a character...
Can you tell me where I could find him?
What you should do right now is to get into that house over there. That would point you in the right direction.
But the house is locked...
I know there's a three-part key that unlocks it. I've heard that you already have at least one part of it. There's another part under the doormat.
Are you Nora's grandfather? Is she alright?
Oh yes, I am.  But don't you worry about her, I can assure you that she's in good hands and will be well soon.
What's your name?
That's none of your business. You should try to get into that house... you might find some more answers in there.
What's in the house? Why do you want me to get in there?
YOU want to go in there. I'm just telling you it's the right thing to do.
I have to get going.
Somehow I feel like someone is watching me...
What happened? Where's Nora?
I had just brought your granddaughter aboard my ship and was rowing back to the shore, when suddenly a guy with a cape appeared and threw me overboard!
I swam back here ... but that villain stole away with my ship and the girl.
Oh, no!
Hopefully that girl had the good sense to hide herself.
If Vincent finds out about Nora, then she'll be in grave danger!
We have to follow them.
Aye!
Vincent, you devil. If you dare to harm Nora, then I swear I'll hunt you to the end of the earth!
Nora ... I hope you are alright.
Very well done, Nathan!
Now we have to hurry and get Nora home! I have to adjust her mechanical heart!
What if Vincent has already found her?
Check those binoculars... we may be able to spot her.
Mh ... I can see the pier. And the ship.
Yes ... the sailor just brought Nora aboard the ship. Now he's rowing back to the shore ... to pick you up, I guess.
What's that?!
Vincent!! Where did he come from? He threw McManus overboard!
Now he's stealing the sailor's rowboat!
... Where is Nora?! I can't see her.
Oh no ...
It's a golden idol.
This belongs into a museum! I'll take it with me.
No, wait. I should finish this adventure first.
Books on philosophy, mostly ethics, some on anatomy and literature theory.
There are a lot of scientific journals about biology and physics. They smell old, but in a positive way.
Oh and there's an 'Encyclopedia of Science'. Boring too, I guess.
If this bookcase holds a secret door, it won't be revealed simply by pushing on it.
This can't be the correct time ...
How can I correct the time if I have no idea what time it is?
"Your Own Secret Underground Lab", "More about Secret Underground Labs" & "How Do I Keep Rodents From Invading My Secret Underground Lab".
No wonder these books are down there - they sound REALLY boring.
"The Inside Matters". Sounds interesting!
Ok, I'll take it.
They're the metal plates from the socketed bird device.
It seems that Vincent took them out and simply dropped them here.
Ok.
There are two oval-shaped sockets in the base of this statue.
Hey, there's also an inscription...
"Even the spirit of youth and grim death listen to the birds' song. For without words it will teach wisdom. For without key it will open up the path of truth." Wu Xun.
It looks like there's something missing here... both sockets are empty.
I've now filled one socket, but the other is still empty.
It looks like it's been completely activated.
Here we go.
One plate is still missing.
The bird's song opened up a secret passage, just like the inscription said.
If the mud was cleaned off this dirty object, then it might just fit into one of those sockets!
It's a beautiful golden bird sitting on a branch.
It seems to be part of a larger mechanical device controlling something in this room...
Open Sesame?
Hmm, that doesn't seem to work.
I assume that I'll need to fill those oval-shaped sockets in the base to activate whatever this mechanism is.
It's a buddha. It seems to be a very old statue.
Maybe later...
I use to question everything, so I'm not a religious person.
But even that's not for sure.
It would be exceptionally bad karma to steal Coppelius' buddha.
Old wine. It was bottled over 60 years ago.
I'm not stealing Dr. Coppelius' liquor!
The bottle contains a strange blue fluid.
No. That's not a good idea.
I'd guess it's some sort of cleaning fluid for combs.
I'm not a barber so I'll leave it right here.
Nice ivy.
These are all old letters. Some are even from Cairo ... another is from Delhi.
These are all letters addressed to Dr. Coppelius.
Hey! There are even some from my university... but the newest ones arrived here over one year ago.
It's a picture of a newborn child with its mother.
It's a picture of a middle-aged man. He looks healthy.
It's a picture of an old man. He looks tired.
It's a picture of a puppet. Without age and emotion.
Hey! It's the Beatles!
Except ... John Lennon is wearing an eyepatch and Ringo Starr is an old woman.
My mistake, these are really just old family photos.
This is a list of radio frequencies.
You can radio Glasgow, Hamburg, Venice ...
... and a place just called "Island Radio Station". Strange.
If I had a working radio then I might be able to use these.
It's a radio for transmitting and receiving radio messages.
It doesn't work. There's no power.
It's full of small tools.
To be honest, I'm not very good with mechanical things.
I don't have the slightest idea of what some of these tools are used for.
I wonder what Dr. Coppelius is working on here...
Whatever it is, there sure are a lot of cogs and springs inside.
I'd better not. I have no idea what it is.
"Wahrheit währt am längsten"
It translates as "Truth will last longer than anything". I guess it's an old german proverb.
The books up there are about different cultures all over the world. Southern Ghana, Mexico, Hokkaido, Wales and others.
Ah! Finally some fiction. He has a good collection. From Kafka, Chesterton, E.T.A. Hoffmann and Hemingway ...
... to Gaiman and Carroll. And then back to the classics: Shakespeare, Goethe and Steve Martin.
Hmm, Winnie the Pooh is missing. This Coppelius is a strange man.
I'd never get around to reading them.
There are several markers in different regions of western africa.
I wonder if Dr. Coppelius has been there ...
These impressive masks are made from wood and straw.
Probably African.
I don't see anything special about that.
No, thanks.
What should I do with it?
How should I use this?
I don't think that's useful.
I don't think that'll work.
I think that's useless.
It's a piece of barbed wire.
It's thin and sharp. Maybe I can pick a lock with this?
The title of the book is "The Inside Matters" ... What does that mean?
Let's see... Hey! There's a golden plate inside.
I'll discard the empty book and just keep the plate.
It's a corked bottle of alcohol.
I pulled the cork out with my teeth.
The cork is too tight to pull out with my hands.
That won't uncork it.
It's almost empty.
I'm not in the mood for drinking right now.
Alcohol is never a good solution for problems.
It's a full bottle of alcohol.
Half-full or half-empty? That's the question.
It's a piece of cloth.
I could try to clean something... but the cloth is too dry.
Now it's a wet piece of cloth soaked in alcohol.
I could clean something...
That doesn't need to be cleaned.
It's a light cork.
It's the fish I caught.
I'm really sorry about this, fish. I've never liked fishing, you know.
I don't like raw fish.
A dead fish isn't needed here.
It's my handmade fishing-rod. With bait.
I should go fishing.
This is not a good place for fishing.
It's my handmade fishing rod.
I should go fishing, but I'll need to bait the hook first.
Plus I need to bait the hook.
It's a glove. I need a second one to make a pair.
How should I use a single glove?
It's a pair of gloves.
I don't want to wear them all the time.
It's the handle from the well.
I have to use it with something.
It's a small and sharp metal hook.
Ouch! It's sharp.
It's "Captn Matt's Guide to Life". Looks interesting. I should try reading it.
"Chapter 27: How to stun a Raven."
"On one of my travels through the Caribbean it became necessary to drug a raven. "
"Should you get into a similar situation just follow these instructions."
"First get some kind of nice looking bird food, some strong alcohol and finally add the SETA DE MUERTE. The Mushroom of Death (not deadly)."
"Mix the three ingredients in a cup or bowl. Now give the cereal to the raven. Feed the bird until it falls asleep."
"After that you can proceed with whatever you were doing - just like I continued to search for the Voodoo Priest. For further details see Chapter 51 ‘Coco Island’"
Hey, I think that's a useful hint. Mix cereal, alcohol and Mushroom of Death. I think I got it.
I should read the book instead.
It seems to be a part of a larger key.
A single part of a key is rather useless.
These two parts fit together. But there's still a part missing.
An incomplete key is rather useless.
A complete three-part key. Whatever this unlocks, it must be important.
The key doesn't fit here.
I can't use the key here.
This is only a part of a larger key.
It's a leaflet from the local fishing club. It says:
"The wonderful art of fishing has captured our hearts and imaginations for decades."
"In our childhood, all it took was a long stick, a string, a float, a hook and some bait."
"Come and join our happy circle of fishermen."
Happy circle of fishermen, eh?
You use leaflets by reading them... or by throwing them away.
It's a leaflet from the local fishing club, and it's burning.
That's not good fire safety.
That doesn't need fire.
It's my lighter.
Hi there, lighter.
I don't smoke, but maybe I can use it for something else.
I won't burn this. I'm really careful with fire since that one incident.
It's the legendary mushroom of death. That's funny, these dots look like a small skull.
No!
It's a picture of the house where Dr. Coppelius used to live. I was sent to tell him that he's in great danger.
I don't even know what kind of danger the old men at the university were talking about, but Coppelius is supposed to contact them.
I wonder if Coppelius still lives there. Well, I should try to find out.
It's an oval-shaped golden plate depicting grim death himself.
I hope it's not cursed or something.
It's an oval-shaped golden plate depicting a young adventurer.
It's some muddy piece of metal.
I'm not cleaning this with my tongue!
I can't clean it with my hands. The mud is dry and hard.
That won't get it clean.
These are green seeds that I made by mixing mushroom and alcohol with wheat.
They smell like medicine.
No, I don't want to get sleepy.
That doesn't need to be drugged.
It's a cocktail shaker.
I could shake and mix something, but what?
I've put wheat in it.
I should only mix a complete recipe.
I've put the wheat and alcohol into it.
I've put the mushroom, wheat and alcohol into it. That's it!
Ok, I'll mix it!
I've put the mushroom and wheat in it.
I've put alcohol into it.
I've put the mushroom and alcohol into it.
I've put the mushroom in it.
Wow! An unopened can of Dr Pepper.
I love Dr Pepper.
I'd like to, but I have to open it first.
Good idea. The can is opened.
I won't waste my Dr. Pepper here.
Tastier than a red potion!
And more refreshing than a green herb!
There's nothing left, but I still have the good taste on my tongue. Mh.
I'll keep it intact. Maybe I can use it later.
It's open! The smell, the sound. Wonderful.
Cheers!
It's a long stick.
How could I use this?
A stick with a cork on a string.
It looks like a whip with a cork... So far it's useless.
There's no need to do that.
A stick with a hook on a string. Hey! It looks like a fishing-rod.
I need something to make the hook float in the water.
I affixed the string to the long stick.
It looks like a whip; but I know it's not a whip. So far it's useless.
It's a string.
No, I was never very good at cat's cradle.
It's a string with a cork.
It's a string with a cork and a hook.
It's a string with a hook.
Nice wheat.
No, that looks rather like bird food.
There's no need for wheat here.
A cute little fella. Hey, I think he's looking at me.
It seems that he knows I'm up to something.
I'm not sure what I'll do with you ... Maybe it's something bad, so I'll apologize in now advance.
Sorry, worm.
He wriggles.
No, I think I'll keep him here.
I'll pour some alcohol on the cloth.
The cloth is already soaking wet.
Now I have a pair.
Hey, these parts fit together!
The key is now complete.
Now playing with fire might really be useful.
Are you insane?! You make me sick...
That's too dry to clean the mud off.
Now it's clean.
I'll add it to the shaker.
I'll put some wheat into the shaker.
I'll pour some alcohol into the shaker.
I'll put the mushroom into the shaker.
I'll attach it to the string.
Good idea, but I'll need a float to make a fishing rod.
I'll attach the string to the stick.
I could go fishing, but first I'd need a proper fishing rod.
It's a waterwheel.
It reads, "Wanderer's Path".
I could follow the sign... It's pointing south.
It's the house from the photograph! This is where Dr. Coppelius used to live.
It looks a little worn-out ...
Hello! Is someone in there?
Apparently no one is home.
Hmm. Nora said that her grandfather was around this house. I don't see any signs of him though...
Perhaps he went the other way? Nora said that they were meeting McManus down at the pier.
I have to find Nora's grandfather... she needs his help!
It looks a little bit older now, but this is definitely the house in the picture.
There's no glass. Just bricks and paint.
Bricks and paint... the windows were closed years ago.
The clock hands are missing.
I have no idea what time it is.
There's no use for a clock without hands.
It's a rough mat to wipe your shoes on.
There's something under the doormat.
There's a tiny key hidden underneath...
Hmmm. It seems too small to be a real key.
It's the entrance door to the house.
Is anyone home? Hello?
It's firmly locked.
I should try to get in there and warn the doctor.
Good idea, but the wire doesn't even fit into the keyhole.
That alone doesn't fit.
This key is still incomplete.
The key to match the lock. Finally.
It's an iron gate with a raven depicted on it.
It's locked.
Hmm... maybe I can pick the lock?
This should be able to pick the lock...
It's open!
It's a piece of cloth tied to a long stick. It makes some kind of flag or sign.
Ok. I'll do that.
It's a map of this part of Ravenhollow Bay.
It seems there's an island near the coast.
I don't think I need that right now.
"Note to self - don't forget: Vincent will come for you too. Leave before he does and take everything with you that he might find useful. Hide."
"PS: don't tell Nora, it's far too dangerous. You promised to look after her."
Don't tell Nora ...?
Eh, no.
"Note to self - Danger! Don't use pod prototype. Chance to survive escape is minimal."
What's that supposed to mean?
They're empty.
There's nothing in them.
It's a box with bird food.
No thanks.
No thanks. I've had my fill of birdseed.
I can't reach it from here.
"Phosphorus and Lily". An impressive oil painting.
It's called "Britt's Place".
That's a pair of binoculars.
Mh ... puedo ver el embarcadero.
Nora, the sailor, and his dog are down there.
It seems that Vincent doesn't want us to follow him.
He's closed the entrance.
I can't go up there. The secret entrance was closed.
I guess it can only be opened from the other side.
It's closed.
It's locked.
It's not locked!
Hey, I found some of the things that Vincent stole from me!
At least I have some of my things back.
Now I just need to get out of here.
It's empty.
I'll leave it be.
I can see the sea out there ...
This place must be somewhere below the cliff.
It's a framed photograph of a bearded man wearing a cowboy hat.
Who are you looking at, gringo?
Hey, there was something hidden behind the picture.
There's a small circular arrow painted next to the hole.
Something's missing here...
That seems to fit.
This handle should work to open the gate.
Here we go...
Hey, it worked!
I could open the gate if only I could reach the handle.
I can't reach it...
Hmm. The crow seems to be Dr. Coppelius' pet bird.
He's still sleeping.
WAKE UP!
He's awake.
Come here. Come, come.
Remember me? I made you sleepy...
Well, at least he seems to be listening to me.
Come on, come to Uncle Nathan!
Thanks, my friend. You've been a really helpful crow.
Looks like he had enough sleep. I'm glad he's well.
Too bad, I can't get a good view of those paintings beyond it.
How can I open it?
It won't move.
Vincent locked us in here ... that devil!
Interesting! It seems that we are under the pond next to the house.
It's some kind of sophisticated chair.
It looks like someone was searching for something here.
Fortunately I got rid of everything that might be useful for Vincent.
That would be a bad idea.
They're just a lot of boring books.
Watch your tongue, young man.
Sorry.
These books do not spark my interest.
Hey, would you like me to come over to your place and tell you what I think about your things?
Sure... if I should ever have my own secret room filled with boring books, then I'll invite you. I'm sure you'd like that.
Are these mathematical formulas?
Something like that.
These formulas are way over my head.
There are a couple of flasks. Some of them are broken.
Useless.
Unless you know how to use them ...
The radio is on.
Not right now.
I don't want to make Dr. Coppelius angry.
They're nothing special.
May I take some of these papers?
You may not.
Someone left all these papers on the floor.
Don't touch my papers!
Ok, ok. Don't worry.
It's some sort of plan...
It's the construction plan for a wireless phone.
I wonder how long it took Vincent to realize that it's useless.
... of course it's impossible to build a wireless phone.
Take your hands off that plan!
It's a mysterious and massive metal pod.
It's very rusty.
Maybe there's something locked inside, that shouldn't be set free.
Maybe not, Nathan.
There's nothing inside ...
But it's really cozy in here!
I wonder what happens when I press this little red button here...
Me too .....
What!?
That's the tunnel I escaped through.
No thanks, my first pass through that shaft was bad enough.
Coppelius!
None other!
You're Dr. Coppelius? ... but ... then who is he?
Nothing but a thief and a traitor. Vincent, I won't let you steal my invention!
Trust me, old man, I'll find it. I've collected dozens of them.
You and your colleagues should have accepted my offer to join me.
After I've stolen your plans and inventions, I'll take over the country and you'll be wiped away. Haha!
I'll never allow my work to fall into your hands. No righteous man would ever join you, Vincent!
I'll find your invention, Coppelius! Sooner or later I'll find it!
It's DR. Coppelius.
What happened? Where did he go? Hey, someone stole all my things!
Vincent walked out of the room while we were unconscious.
He locked us in here ... We have to get out!
Dr. Coppelius...?
Could this be Dr. Coppelius? He looks more sinister than I expected.
Excuse me, are you Dr. Coppelius?
I've expected you... I knew he was going to send someone in here, but someone like you? A little desperate - the old man!
What are you talking about?
You're nothing but a puppet! If you weren't so insignificant, I would tear you apart and put you back together again...
I could even purge your memories and whisper new ones into your empty brain.
Then you'd serve me and execute my commands. See? You could still become useful - isn't that just wonderful?!
No ... who are you?!
I'd better avoid roughing up random strangers.
There's a group of scientists ... mh...
Hey, you're pictured here, too.
Indeed, I am.
No, I'll leave it here.
It's some kind of tank that is connected to the pod.
There's a flammability symbol painted on the side.
How? Maybe I can put something in there ...
I'll put the burning leaflet into the tank.
Don't try this at home, kids!
It seems that I've started a fire within the tank.
Is that a good thing?
Good idea... if I could just start a fire in the boiler, then this could make it hotter.
How? Maybe I can put something else in there.
I'll put the rest of the alcohol into the tank.
I'll put in these seeds, too.
This should burn, too.
I've put quite enough into that boiler.
Dr. Coppelius, I was sent to find you.
I know, I know. The university wants to know if I'm still alive.
Yes. I'm supposed to tell you that you are in great danger!
Well, I know that! That's why I had to hide. I guess my old colleagues were worried enough that they sent you to find me.
What kind of danger are you in?
I knew Vincent was after me... I had to hide to protect my invention. My granddaughter would be in great danger, too, if Vincent found out about my invention.
Nora?
Yes, Nora ... I promised to look after her.
Who is Vincent?
Well, do you see that old photograph over there? Have a look at it and I'll tell you ...
What invention was Vincent talking about?
After many years of research I was able to construct  that what scientists dream to achieve since generations ...
I constructed a mechanical heart!
A mechanical heart?
Yes! A mechanical heart could be the motor for every kind of device ... it's very effective. It just needs a small amount of electric energy.
Imagine ... a mechanical heart that keeps a tank rolling, providing the energy for planes, beating in the chest of a robot man...
... or in the chest of a sick young girl.
What do you mean?
Wait ... Nora??
Yes! She was the reason I invested thousands of hours into research ... she was very sick.
The only prototype that ever worked was not perfect ... from time to time the device needs to be adjusted ... but it helped my granddaughter Nora to survive.
Now I understand why you wanted to keep your invention a secret. If Vincent knew about it then ...
... Nora would be in great danger! Yes.
But why did you come here? Why risk running into Vincent?
When I left I forgot some notes that could help me to keep Nora from getting sick. I didn't know that Vincent was already here.
Then why did you want me to get into the house?

Well, I don't know how Vincent got in... but I tried to make it as complicated as possible to get down here. Unfortunately I couldn't remember how to get in here myself ... it seems I'm getting too old.
What is this place?
This is my research laboratory.
About two years ago I heard that Vincent was after our discoveries and that several members of our research team had disappeared.

We tried to stay in contact via radio and mail but after I lost one contact after the other I decided that it's better to leave and to destroy everything that might be useful for Vincent and his evil plans.
So that's why the university doesn't know where you are?
Exactly.
How do we get out of here?
Well, that escape pod over there would be an option, but ...
Escape? That sounds perfect!
Yes ... well ... it has its quirks.
How can I use it?
Maybe you're right, we don't have a choice.
First you'll have to get get a fire started in the boiler ... then put in anything that might burn. Anything that contains alcohol would help.
That should generate enough steam to activate the pod.
First: Start a fire. Second: Put in highly flammable things ... I should be able to do that.
I'll try to get us out of here.
Very good.
It's the long way back to the village.
I can't leave. Not yet.
It's dead.
The dry branches would make perfect firewood.
It's an old bridge, but the wood still looks strong and trustworthy.
I can only use it to get to the other side.
That cart has seen better days...
I wonder who left you here.
I can't use it. It's definitely broken.
Is that a coffin? Creepy.
It looks like it was opened from inside...
I'm not going in there!
There's something shiny stuck between the boards.
What's this?
It's the well handle.
Ooops!
It's the handle from the well.
Okay. It might be useful.
It's an old well.
Hello!? Is anyone down there?
No one is answering. Good.
I should use the handle.
It broke when I touched it.
It's a nice lantern.
I don't want to. I don't like darkness.
No, it's already lit.
It looks like he's on a hiking trip.
Excuse me...
Why hello!
No.
I don't want to duel him!
Those are nice looking mushrooms.
No, they might be poisonous.
I have no idea what kind of mushrooms these are.
I should only take what I really need.
It's a crow.
Someone has tied a golden chain with a key to his leg.
Hi there.
Come on ... you don't need this key, right?
No. He's going to bite my fingers off, I know it.
Try this, my friend.
It seems that he likes them... and I do believe that he looks slightly tired now.
How about another delicious and crunchy sedative seed?
He definitely looks tired now.
How about one more delicious and crunchy sedative seed?
Hmm... I guess he flew away to take a nap.
I'll have to find him.
A dry branch.
There's no light.
Now it's open.
That should work, but I'll have to open the lantern first.
It's already open.
Nice warm light.
No. I really don't like darkness.
There's no need to do that anymore.
I'm Nathan. Who are you?
Hi Nathan. I'm Gregory, a traveller.
A pleasure to meet you. May I call you Greg?
...Er, sure.
Where are you off to, Greg?
Right now I'm heading to Leipzig to meet my friend, Matthew.
We have a street performance act that we're taking on the road!
Neat, what's your act?
I juggle fire while Matthew tells adventurous short stories.
Wow, that sounds great!
Who knows, maybe you'll catch our act someday.
Are you connected to the mystery that surrounds this remote area?
I don't think so, but I may be able to help.
Whenever I ponder a mystery, I crack a can of soda to help me think.
Here, try this!
Wow, thanks! A can of Dr. Pepper, my favorite!
No problem, mate!
Do you know a Dr. Coppelius?
Sorry, I can't help. I'm just passing through these parts.
So ... you don't know him?
Can't say that I do.
Okay, just thought I'd ask.
So, you're sure you don't know a Dr. Coppelius?
Still no.
I see.
Well, I gotta go.
See ya, Nathan!
